sentences.english: You’re probably one of those weirdos that doesn’t drink coffee in the morning either.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可能也是那种早晨不用喝咖啡的古怪人。

sentences.english: Maybe some newsy remembers an odd customer.
sentences.chinese: 也许哪个卖报的还记得这么个古怪的顾客。
《威尔逊》是一部古怪的文献片，于1944年公演。

sentences.english: Her behaviour became increasingly erratic, and she was often drunk on stage.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为越来越古怪，有时在舞台上都是醉醺醺的。

sentences.english: It is an odd thing to have happened to me, but it is what it is. I have become obsessed with sewing.
sentences.chinese: 我感到十分古怪，但就是这样，我已经为缝纫而痴迷。

sentences.english: The quality of being eccentric . They all goggled at my funny clothes.
sentences.chinese: 他们个个睁大眼睛，瞧着我穿的古怪服装。

sentences.english: That said, working with the non-Google apps was an odd experience.
sentences.chinese: 说到这个，用非谷歌程序的经验则十分的古怪。

sentences.english: Léon: Stay away from him. He looks like a weirdo.
sentences.chinese: 离那家伙远一点，他看起来很古怪。

sentences.english: Is he, you know, like some kind of weird simpleton?
sentences.chinese: 那个谁，你知道吗，像古怪的傻子似的是谁？

sentences.english: He rushed about doing preposterous things in an extraordinary manner.
sentences.chinese: 他奔来奔去，离奇古怪地干下了种种荒谬的事情。

sentences.english: You two have the most dysfunctional idea of love I've ever seen.
sentences.chinese: 你们的兄弟之情恐怕是我见过的最古怪的了。

sentences.english: A couple of codgers got into a quarrel and came before the local magistrate.
sentences.chinese: 一对古怪的老人在到法官面前，开始不停地争执。

sentences.english: IT was probably the weirdest sound I’d ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 这可能是我听到的最古怪的声音了。

sentences.english: That such efforts are needed is at first sight odd.
sentences.chinese: 这种举动的必要性初看有点古怪。

sentences.english: Who will tell the children those 3)outlandish stories?
sentences.chinese: 谁将把这些稀奇古怪的故事告诉我们的后辈呢？

sentences.english: Have you ever had odd experiences like this?
sentences.chinese: 你有过这样的古怪的经历吗？

definition: to be amazed/to be surprised/to wonder
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
